name: Seoul
cities: Seoul City Center · Palaces · Hongdae · Myeongdong · Han River · Itaewon · Gangnam

schedule.description: Private vehicle transfer to hotel (approx. 1 hour). Rest after check-in. Charter bus or minivan assigned for groups of 5–50 persons.

K-Beauty shopping paradise · Olive Young, Innisfree, Laneige and other cosmetics street. Stores open 10:30–22:00. Street food stalls 16:00–23:00. Halal restaurants: Busan Jib (Halal BBQ), Kampungku (Malaysian food · prayer room available), Gurkha (Indian & Nepali Halal). Group tip: Groups of 20+ should split into 2–3 subgroups for shopping and then regroup. Photo spots: Myeongdong main street neon signs, Myeongdong Cathedral night view.

schedule.place: N Seoul Tower (N Seoul Tower · Namsan Tower)
schedule.description: Travel by Namsan cable car or bus. Mon–Fri 12:00–22:00, weekends 11:00–22:00 (last entry 21:30). 360° panoramic night view of Seoul city center. Duration approx. 1.5–2 hours. Photo spots: night view from observatory glass window, Love Lock Plaza, Namsan trail Seoul city view. Group tip: Cable car wait times increase for groups of 30+ — bus transfer recommended. Open 365 days a year.

schedule.place: Hanbok Rental → Gyeongbokgung Palace (景福宮 · Gyeongbokgung Palace)
schedule.description: Arrive at hanbok rental shop at 09:00 (50m walk from Gyeongbokgung Station Exit 4). Free admission to Gyeongbokgung when wearing hanbok! Open 09:00–18:00 (varies by season), closed Tuesdays. English guided tours at 11:00, 13:30 & 15:30 (advance reservation required for groups of 10+, max 30 persons). Duration approx. 1.5–2 hours. Must-see: Sujeongjeon, Geunjeongjeon, and Gyeonghoeru. Photo spots: Geunjeongjeon front, Gyeonghoeru pond reflection, Hyangwonjeong bridge. Group tip: Advance reservation required for large groups renting hanbok — groups of 50 should use 2 rental shops.

Located next to Gyeongbokgung South Gate. Free admission. Open 10:00–18:00 (until 21:00 on Wed & Sat for evening opening). Exhibits of Joseon royal artifacts, royal seals, and treasures. Duration approx. 40–60 minutes. Air-conditioned throughout — ideal rest stop in summer and winter. Group tip: Free exploration without a guide recommended; split into 2 teams for groups of 20+.

schedule.place: Bukchon Hanok Village (北村韓屋마을 · Bukchon Hanok Village)
schedule.description: 15-minute walk from Gyeongbokgung. Free admission. 600 traditional hanok alleyhouses with 100 years of history. Visiting hours 10:00–17:00 (tourism restricted 17:00–10:00 from March 2025). Duration approx. 1–1.5 hours. Photo spots: top of Bukchon-ro 11-gil (hanok alley with Namsan Tower backdrop), Bukchon 8 scenic spots. Group tip: This is a residential area — move quietly; large groups should split into subgroups of 10. Visiting in hanbok makes for life-worthy photos!

10-minute walk from Bukchon. Free street. Traditional crafts, Korean tea, galleries, and Ssamziegil multi-cultural complex. Ssamziegil open 10:30–20:30. Duration approx. 1–1.5 hours. Halal note: vegetarian bibimbap and tofu dishes available in Insadong; halal Korean food experience possible with advance booking. Photo spots: Ssamziegil spiral staircase, Korean signboards along Insadong street.

schedule.place: Gwangjang Market (廣藏市場 · Gwangjang Market)
schedule.description: One subway stop from Insadong. Free entry (food purchased separately). Open 09:00–23:00. Korea's oldest traditional market (established 1905). Halal note: most stalls use pork or non-halal meat — Muslim visitors are recommended to choose plant-based options such as vegetable pancake (yachae-jeon), japchae (no meat), silkworm bread, and hotteok. Guide will direct guests to halal-friendly stalls in advance. Duration approx. 1–1.5 hours. Photo spots: panoramic view of food stall alley, bindaetteok (mung bean pancake) being cooked.

5-minute walk from Gwangjang Market. Free admission. Open 24 hours. 5.8km urban artificial stream night walking trail. Enjoy sections with LED lighting installations. Winter (Dec–Jan) Seoul Lantern Festival — large lantern displays along the entire Cheonggyecheon stream, free admission. Duration approx. 30–45 minutes of walking. Photo spots: night view from Gwangtonggyo Bridge, Cheonggye Plaza spring sculpture, Supyogyo LED tunnel. Group tip: As a walking trail, large groups can move freely.

Directly connected to Jamsil Station. Open 10:00–21:00 (last entry 20:00). 123rd floor, 555m — Korea's tallest observatory · Skywalk · transparent floor viewing. Duration approx. 1–1.5 hours. Photo spots: transparent glass floor, Skydeck Seoul panorama, Seokchon Lake view. Group tip: Group discounts available with advance reservation for 20+ persons — arriving at opening time 10:00 recommended to reduce wait. Optional add-on: Lotte World Adventure (indoor theme park) — suitable alternative on rainy or snowy days. Sun–Thu 10:00–21:00, Fri–Sat 10:00–22:00.

Directly connected to Samsung Station. Free admission. Open 10:00–22:00, open year-round. 13m-high grand bookshelf · 70,000 volumes · Instagram landmark. Shopping and dining connected within COEX Mall. Duration approx. 30–60 minutes (1.5 hours including shopping). Photo spots: central atrium bookshelf panorama (wide-angle lens recommended), looking down from 2nd floor balcony. Group tip: Recommended to give group free time then regroup at food court. Halal restaurants: Halal Guy inside COEX Mall (Thai food), Bibigo (bibimbap & tofu menu, Muslim-friendly).

Hongik University Station Exit 9. Free street. Street performances active on weekend afternoons and evenings (Walkway Street · Hongdae Playground area). K-pop dance crews, beatboxers, live painting. Independent cafes, vintage shops, and concept stores. Gyeongui Line Forest Trail in Yeonnam-dong popular. Duration approx. 1.5–2 hours. Halal restaurants: many Muslim-friendly restaurants (Hongdae Islamic restaurant, halal chicken specialty shops). Photo spots: Hongdae walkway street murals, Gyeongui Line Forest Trail cafe street, Yeontral Park. Group tip: Less crowded if visiting before 18:00; street performances peak Fri–Sat 19:00–22:00.

schedule.place: Han River Park & Cruise (漢江 · Han River Park & Cruise)
schedule.description: Yeouido Han River Park or Banpo Han River Park. Free admission (24 hours). Convenience store chicken delivery available (halal alternative: prepare halal lunchboxes with advance order). Banpo Bridge Moonlight Rainbow Fountain operates Apr–Oct (20:00, 20:30, 21:00). Duration: 1 hour park walk + 1 hour cruise. Photo spots: Banpo Bridge rainbow fountain at night, 63 Building & Yeouido skyline from cruise, sunset Han River view. Group tip: Group discounts for cruise reservations — charter cruise available for 40+ persons. Transfer to airport or continue to next module afterwards.

attractions.name: Gyeongbokgung Palace (경복궁)
attractions.feature: Joseon Dynasty's principal palace · Free entry when wearing hanbok · 09:00–18:00 · Closed Tuesdays · English guide tours 11:00/13:30/15:30

attractions.name: National Palace Museum of Korea (국립고궁박물관)
attractions.feature: Joseon royal artifacts and treasures exhibit · 10:00–18:00 (until 21:00 on Wed & Sat) · Fully air-conditioned

attractions.name: Bukchon Hanok Village (Bukchon)
attractions.feature: 600 traditional hanok alleyhouses · Visiting 10:00–17:00 recommended · Photo spot at top of Bukchon-ro 11-gil

attractions.name: Insadong Street (Insadong)
attractions.feature: Traditional crafts, tea & galleries · Ssamziegil multi-cultural complex · Flower tea tasting available

attractions.name: Gwangjang Market
attractions.feature: Korea's oldest traditional market est. 1905 · Bindaetteok, mayak gimbap, yukhoe · 09:00–23:00

attractions.name: N Seoul Tower Observatory
attractions.feature: Namsan 360° night view panorama · Cable car round trip ₩17,000 · Mon–Fri 12:00–22:00 · Open year-round

attractions.name: Lotte World Tower Seoul Sky
attractions.feature: 123rd floor 555m Korea's tallest observatory · Skywalk · Transparent glass floor · 10:00–21:00

attractions.name: Dongdaemun Design Plaza (DDP)
attractions.feature: Zaha Hadid architecture · Futuristic design landmark · 10:00–20:00 · Night LED rose photo zone

attractions.name: Lotte World Adventure (Indoor)
attractions.feature: World's largest indoor theme park · Rides & parades · Sun–Thu 10:00–21:00 · Alternative on rainy days

attractions.name: HYBE Insight
attractions.feature: BTS & Seventeen K-pop experience center · 11:00–21:00 · Closed Mondays · Advance online reservation required (ages 14+)

attractions.name: Hanbok Experience Rental
attractions.feature: Hanbok rental in front of Gyeongbokgung for 2–4 hours · Free palace entry when wearing hanbok · Advance group reservation recommended

attractions.name: Han River Night View Cruise
attractions.feature: 1-hour cruise departing from Yeouido · Banpo Bridge rainbow fountain · Charter available for 40+ persons

attractions.name: DMZ Demilitarized Zone Tour
attractions.feature: Korean Peninsula division site · Panmunjom & Dorasan Station · Full-day tour 6–8 hours · Passport information required in advance

attractions.name: Garosu-gil
attractions.feature: Gangnam trendy cafe and boutique street · Ginkgo tree-lined avenue · Sinsa Station Exit 8

food.name: Halal Korean BBQ (Busan Jib)
food.place: Myeongdong · Halal-certified Korean BBQ and bibimbap

food.name: Kampungku (Malaysian Halal)
food.place: Myeongdong · Nasi lemak, rendang ayam · Prayer room available

food.name: Itaewon Halal Korean Food (Eid Restaurant)
food.place: Near Seoul Central Mosque, Itaewon · Halal Korean food run by Korean Muslims

food.name: Myeongdong Street Food (Halal Options)
food.place: Myeongdong street stalls · Fish cake, hotteok, egg bread (choose pork-free options)

food.name: Gwangjang Market Plant-Based Menu
food.place: Vegetable pancake, japchae, hotteok, mayak gimbap (guide will advise on halal-friendly options)

food.name: COEX Mall Halal Guy
food.place: Thai halal restaurant inside COEX Mall

food.name: Hongdae Halal Chicken
food.place: Hongdae Islamic restaurant · Halal chicken and curry specialty

food.name: Korean Beef (Hanwoo) Course Meal (Special Dinner)
food.place: Gangnam & Myeongdong hanwoo specialty restaurants · Halal-slaughtered hanwoo available with advance order

note: The Seoul module is recommended as the starting point for all itinerary combinations. It is the most suitable first destination for arrivals via Incheon Airport. For Sri Lankan Muslim groups: halal restaurants are concentrated near Seoul Central Mosque in Itaewon, and halal-certified restaurants are also increasing in Myeongdong and Hongdae. Essential to confirm prayer times and nearby prayer rooms (such as Kampungku) in advance. Note: Gyeongbokgung is closed on Tuesdays; tourism in Bukchon is restricted after 17:00 (fine ₩100,000). Large groups (20+ persons) can receive discounts and shorter wait times by making advance group reservations for hanbok rental, cruise, and observatory.
